website_summaries.verdict: Despite occasional quirks, this pan has a lot to offer, including ample cooking space and an impressive warranty that adds to its value.
pros: Offers an impressive feature set that includes nonstick hard anodized cook surface, strong stainless steel handles, and full lifetime warranty
Rated for oven temperatures up to 450°F
cons: A few consumers griped about warping and the finish chipping in spots after a few uses, but many more are impressed with the quality

customer_reviews.title: Is this really Calphalon?
customer_reviews.text: Just received and larger pan defective. The handle was positioned to where end sits lower than pan bottom ( so that pan CANNOT lay flat on stovetop). Am returning set.
customer_reviews.author: Ali D.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this pot!  I have tried two and both are defective!  If I could I would give it a 0 star!
customer_reviews.text: Watch out! Do not buy this pot! I have tried two pots already. And they both are defective! If I could I would give it a 0 star! I'm very unpleased with this product! Because it's made defectively! The size of the pour spouts & straining lid is way too small for the size of the pot! So when I was pouring the soup out through the pour spouts & straining lid, the lid fell out of the pot, not only made a big mess and also burnt my hand!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: I left the pan on the stove for over 20 minutes with the burner turned off so the pan could cool down before washing
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this thing. Metal is too thin and warped after JUST A SINGLE USE!!! I left the pan on the stove for over 20 minutes with the burner turned off so the pan could cool down before washing. Didnt make a difference. Cheap crap.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: 1 star because of the rivets
customer_reviews.text: Bought a full set of 8 pans / pots. I hand wash them every time. They are great pans, except for the rivets. Food sticks horribly to the rivet areas. I end up using a non-scratching type scouring pad, which I'm sure will reduce the durability over time. I will be looking for a set without rivets.
customer_reviews.author: RUNTY 1

customer_reviews.title: Pot can't be fully closed off - big design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This Dutch Oven has a huge flaw - when the lid is on, it is not completely closed! The design of the spouts and the lid is such that there is a gap between the lid and the side of the pot at both the spouts. So there is no such thing as 'cover tightly and simmer' - this pot won't do that! I suppose it is good for pasta, but a Dutch Oven it is not. I am so disappointed with it, and am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PAN!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not only did the pan bow after only a few uses, even with careful washing after being totally cooled down, but after 7 months something happened to the bottom of the pan that caused it to deeply scratch my cooktop!. My husband was able to get the cooktop fairly smooth by rubbing with fine sand paper and a product designed for scratches in the lenses of eyeglasses, but it was touch-and-go and pretty anxiety-inducing. I am now afraid to use the pan at all, even though he sanded the ridges off the pan bottom. I have no idea where they came from, and no assurance they will not return and scratch my cooktop again.
customer_reviews.author: N. Cochran

customer_reviews.title: so this was a good choice. The price is reasonable
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult to find a skillet with a matching lid! I also did not want to invest over $100 for a pan, so this was a good choice. The price is reasonable, and the quality is overall pretty good. We have had the pan for several months now, and have not had any of the surface material come off, so it seems to be holding up well. Although I am not IN LOVE with this pan, I like it for every day use, and for the price would definitely consider buying again. The non stick has also held up well, as it does not take too much work to clean if you let it soak first.
customer_reviews.author: A. Durham

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t ask for more
customer_reviews.text: I’ve started steami cooking seitan and so needed to up my Dutch oven game. After quite a bit if searching I found this and I’m really very glad. When I opened the box there must have been some sort of optical illusion because it looked so small! When I took it out and compared it to my old Dutch oven it morphed into its real size. No, I wasn’t smoking anything lol. It’s a nice size and the large diameter helps when steaming. This DO is pretty much exactly what I was looking for. The right size, weight and a nice look. Oh, and easy to clean. Couldn’t ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah X

customer_reviews.title: Had for less than a month and the pan totally ...
customer_reviews.text: Had for less than a month and the pan totally warped. It no longer sits on stove top level and is ABSOLUTELY NOT worth the money. Do not purchase this, it will not last long.
customer_reviews.author: Katerina Colburn

customer_reviews.title: Warped bottom
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this pan because of Calphalon's reputation.It was great for making Spaghetti sauce, but when I tried to use it for pancakes it was awful. the bottom of the pan is so warped that it won't sit flat on the stove. it rocks back and forth and the handle is so heavy that all the batter ran toward the handle end of the pan. I ended up putting something under the handle and making one pancake at a time in the center as that was the only part of the bottom that touched the burner. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M Whitney

customer_reviews.title: This pot is everything....really!!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love , love this pot. I can't tell you how many times I looked for a 1 qt pot with pour spouts sold separately and could never find one. They were always a part of sets and I didn't need that. And this one has a lid with draining holes too!! Seems like a silly thing to be so excited over but this pot has really filled everything I was looking for and more. As always with Caphalon it is well constructed and I look forward to using this for years to come for my usual morning oatmeal.
customer_reviews.author: tennismom

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Calphalon classic nonstick sauce pan w/cover in sizes 1.5, 2.5, & 3.5 & payed a pretty penny. Should have returned as soon as I received them, on the lids of the 2.5 & 3.5 sizes there are no markings showing the strainer sizes & now the 1.5 has scratches on the bottom and only used silicone tools with them. Even though they came in original looking boxes I think they are knock offs. Not a happy prime member!
customer_reviews.author: Jonrd

customer_reviews.title: PAN SET PANNED
customer_reviews.text: It looks right. At first weight feels okay in one's hand. But this pan set is beyond disappointing. Especially from Calphalon which usually offers high quality pieces. Handle is substantial but conducts heat too much. The pan is too thin, heating too high too fast, and nearly impossible to use for any cooking reliably on gas range; maybe okay for electric (but I doubt it). The handle gets scorching hot, burning one's hand. Don't buy this pan set. I can't use these. I should have looked at material density in specs. There are plenty of excellent, affordable pans and pan sets for a few dollars more that you'll use happily for years.
customer_reviews.author: Missy Finney

customer_reviews.title: Pan Bottom Warped After a Few Uses
customer_reviews.text: The size of this pan is perfect, plenty of surface area, and the nonstick is easy to clean, but after a month or so of use, the bottom warped, and it will no longer sit flat on my ceramic stovetop. I never put it in the dishwasher or the oven. This happened with regular use. I am attempting to get a replacement per the warranty. We’ll see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Romance Reader

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This is our third pan. My husband likes cooking with it which is why we buy it. We only wash with Calphalon approved sponges and never in the dishwasher. We have to continue to replace them as the non-stick coating comes off even with proper care. Wish they could improve this as otherwise a great pan to cook with.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Page

customer_reviews.title: Cook for your entire battalion
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a larger saute pan than the one I had so I ordered this one. Apparently I didn't realize just how big a 5 quart saute pan is. This sucker is HUGE! It's also heavy so you'll develop some good arm muscles if you use it frequently. All kidding aside, this is a well made, durable, easy to clean pan with all of the quality Calphalon is known for and you'll be grateful for it's hefty size at your next dinner party of family gathering.
customer_reviews.author: LuvKeeshonden

customer_reviews.title: Was good until it shattered everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Lid shattered when wilting spinach. There wasn’t a big temperature change to cause this. I lifted the lid to stir the spinach and the lid shattered and collapsed into the pan. Really dangerous. Has really put me off this style of pan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Calphalon Classic Nonstick Sauite Pan
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookware, it doesn't matter if it is Teflon coated or not. I have been using this cookware since the 80's. This pan is deeper than the frying pan, you can sear you meats and continue adding and cook everything right in the same pan.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought an extra set.
customer_reviews.text: I finally upgraded my kitchen pots and pans with a Calphalon set. I loved the set so much I wanted to buy a couple of extra frying pans. These pans are great. Very sturdy. Oven safe. The only thing to note: they are handwash only. If you are a fan of just throwing pans in the dishwasher – you’re out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Bad design limits the usefulness of this dutch oven.
customer_reviews.text: This pot is extremely shallow, and the cover is very deep. Practically, you can only cook about 3.7 quarts of volume, not the advertised 5-quart capacity, which is by far my biggest issue. The handle on the cover also gets very hot, as it appears they did not consider this issue (most other brands of covers have insulated handles). Finally, the shape of the cover tends to hold water and liquids, making it a bit messy and harder to clean, although this is partially due to the drainhole design.
customer_reviews.author: hammertime

customer_reviews.title: The glass lid design is the problem.
customer_reviews.text: The glass lid design for the Calphalon Classic Nonstick Dutch Oven with Cover, is the problem. The inside of the glass lid will catch any small food item cooked in this Dutch Oven. Small particles of food will wedge in-between the glass lid and metal sides, making it difficult to remove. Other than problem of the food being stuck in the lid it is a nice dutch oven.
customer_reviews.author: Another Review2

customer_reviews.title: They are good but...
customer_reviews.text: The smaller pan arrived chipped fro one of the sides. I don't think I will returned them as I don't want to bother with going to the UPS store and all that (during this time). The heat distribution is ok on the big one as the items in the pan slide to one side on the stove. They are easy to clean and the heat resistance is good. Not sure if I will buy online next time due to this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the pan won't last long
customer_reviews.text: Great shape and size. It's not heavy and easy to use. I've been using this pan for about one month, so far so good. My only hope is that the nonstick layer will last longer since normally I change my nonstick pan around half to one year. After five months of using the pan almost everyday it started to get sticky and the bottom wasn't flat when heated. It seems it's time to get another new pan.
customer_reviews.author: Jun

customer_reviews.title: Third one obviously my wife loves it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one., Number two was recycled to my daughter and she loves it even though it has a few scratches on the bottom. My wife is careful and only uses plastic or wood utensils with it The only reason it's only four stars is because even if we are careful the bottom scratches very easily.
customer_reviews.author: frequent user

customer_reviews.title: Leaking
customer_reviews.text: Used for the first time today March 15, 2020. Noticed the pot leaking where the handle is riveted to pot. Calphalon has always been a good product, but this pot is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Joseph Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Calphalon Quality has greatly reduced.
customer_reviews.text: After 10 years my skillet gave out. So I bought this replacement and I’ve had it less than a year and it has already started to flake. I don’t overheat them or use metal tools. It is washed and dried by hand after using and cooling down. What a disappointment to have had one last 10 years and this one become useless in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: I’m very pleased with the updated style of the new units
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a calphalon loyalist since I got my first set of their pots and pans about 10 years ago. In that time, the original pans have held up to much abuse at the hands of my husband and our housemate. Those jerks dishwasher-ed them, used metal implements on them, and generally did everything wrong regardless of how many times I threatened them. Only in the past year or so had the pots and pans started to become unusuable, so I threw a few out and purchased new. I’m very pleased with the updated style of the new units, this pot is great. It arrived quickly and well packed.
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: For 5 qt. Non-stick saute pan w/lid: Fresh out of the (undamaged) box, and defective. The pan looks like it was crushed, so the bottom does not lay flat, and the round skillet is egg-shaped. The lid won't fit, of course, and the pan is scuffed on the outside surface. I have called the company for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Miller

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PUT IN DISHWASHER
customer_reviews.text: It was accidentally ran through the dishwasher ONCE (a week after buying it) and the entire outside finish came off. Now anything that touches it turns black. I suspect there is a problem with the outside finish in general, looking at other reviews...the dishwasher just speeds it along.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pan is a nice weight and absolutely does not stick
customer_reviews.text: The pan is a nice weight and absolutely does not stick. The weird thing is that it warps while cooking and then flattens when it cools off. UPDATE! The pan now does not flatten after cooling, stays warped. The small handle gets hot.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa B Harris

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: Great pans. Use to make over medium eggs. Flips easily without fat added to pans. We love this brand as they are very reliable. Just replaced our 25 yr old one. Recommend no dishwasher as the heat after a few years eats away the outside. Use rubber spatula always to keep Teflon safe. You won’t be disappointed. Great value with 2 sizes included.
customer_reviews.author: David V

customer_reviews.title: Good pan but not quite what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The pan is fine but it seems I received something different from what I expected. I was expecting the pan to have 2 handles as depicted in the description and photos (see my photo vs Amazon). Not a huge deal but it would have been nice to receive what I thought I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A McGettrick

customer_reviews.title: Quality pans
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the quality, and especially the 10" size. My existing and new 8" are perfect for some things but needed one slightly larger (and smaller than the 12" pan I have) and this is it. And I will not buy any that will not tolerate a higher oven heat as I use in oven also almost as often as on top of stove. I like the balance and feel of the handle too. Perfect for my cooking for two.
customer_reviews.author: Scruzie

customer_reviews.title: Great Plan
customer_reviews.text: This was an addition to the Calphalon pans I have, needed a larger 'fry' type to reduce the splatter when cooking. Cooks evenly on a solid surface electric stove, and large enough for stir fry or other combination meal, e.g. pasta, meat and vegetables. Would definitely recommend these pans "Classic Nonstick".
customer_reviews.author: gracie2003

customer_reviews.title: Hot handle!
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this product a 3 stars because of the fact the handle gets super hot on the smaller pan. I was heading up a pizza on my pan, and when I went to pick up the pan, the handle was so hot I burnt myself! I couldn’t believe how hot it was. And I wasn’t even grabbing super close to the pan itself. I glad to get a towel to wrap around the handle before I could pick it up. Now I have to get a head resistance handle cover which will cost me more money.
customer_reviews.author: Dayneen Moriwaki

customer_reviews.title: This Fry Pan is a Bowl
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year of relatively little use, this fry pan warps into a round bottom pan when placed on a cook top. I suspect that's not something that the folks at Calphalon planned on. It's certainly not something that they want to address either. Customer Support apparently only exists on their website, because I am still waiting after weeks for my case number to fall into someone's hands. If I ever hear from them, I'll let you know. Customer beware alert on this one.
customer_reviews.author: James Reck

customer_reviews.title: buy these right now
customer_reviews.text: my husband found these pans through a google search for best nonstick pans. I am SO glad he bought them. They're amazing. No matter what we cook - eggs, chorizo, veggies, tofu, reheating leftovers, etc NOTHING STICKS. And no need for extra oil! Plus, they're super easy to wipe down and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Larger pan wasn't flat.
customer_reviews.text: The small pan is great, the larger pan was not perfectly flat and rocks slightly on the burner. I'm sure Amazon would have allowed me to return them but I didn't feel like bothering so I will just us it as is. Otherwise the build quality seems good and the nonstick surface works very well. Clean up is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Hooligan Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great pot UPDATE Below :(
customer_reviews.text: At first I was vert happy with the 1.5 quart and bought the rest of the classic. I spent a chunk of money. This 1.5 ended up with some slight manufacture defects which I ASSUMED would be no big issue. It is late June 2020 almost July, and I have been trying to get a warranty exchange since FEBURARY 2020! I am super unhappy with the customer service and now have been on HOLD again for maybe 20 or more minutes waiting to see if they can send me a pan. I might just throw these in my RV as junk pans and buy from someone else after this, sad
customer_reviews.author: Laryssa W

customer_reviews.title: No Ceramic coating, does not correspond to the description. I dont keep poison in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: So I bought it because the description said ceramic PFOA-free nonstick coating. Not only it is not ceramic at all, it is a standard PTFE coating that I've been trying to avoid for some years now. Misleading description. Stop waisting people's time and money!
customer_reviews.author: Olena Marchenko

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great pan. Large. Non stick. Easy to clean with a little soap and water soft brush or rag. I love that it has a lid to give a little steam to veggies you’re sautéing. Used it for eggs and veggie and sauces so far. I read you shouldn’t use non stick sprays on these so we haven’t. We just use a little oil or butter if needed for cooking. But you don’t need anything to keep it from sticking anyways.
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: Love my Calphalon fry pan.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Calphalon 12" fry pan. I bought it over a month ago, and have used it almost daily for all types of cooking and have had no issues. The food never gets stuck to the pan, and the pan is so easy to clean. I have washed it both by hand and in the dish washer and it always comes out looking like new. Both handles remain cool to the touch which is great. I use only wooden or silicon utensils to stir the food so as not to scratch the coating. I will be ordering a smaller 8" pan next.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best non stick pots out there period!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pot to complete a set. I had found all of the other pots at TJ Maxx for awesome prices comparative to the value of this pot. These are truly the best non stick pots I have ever used. Hand wash only! But even that is no problem as the food slides right off. Buying this last pot off Amazon was a last resort as I could not find this size at TJ Maxx. Try them first as the true value of this pot basically equates to a steal at this price point!
customer_reviews.author: Beezee

customer_reviews.title: Super good and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my dad for Christmas since we always seem to ruin his “good nonstick pans” and these have held up super great !! Heats up fast, nothin sticks, and I basically just rinse it off every time I wash it because anything left on the pan comes straight off. I’m super happy with these pans, they’re affordable and really just work great!
customer_reviews.author: ramchdad

customer_reviews.title: Love these pans!
customer_reviews.text: Great pans!!! I love the design and size. I use them everyday for things like eggs, quesadillas, frying vegetables, etc. Nothing sticks even when I have over cooked things. They aren’t the biggest pans (not that deep) to make big skillet meals. Definitely hand wash.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy C.

customer_reviews.title: These pans suit my needs
customer_reviews.text: I had been using Calphalon pots and pans for a long time. My frying pans had worn out from constant abuse, due to my ignorance. These new pans seem solidly made and seem fine to me. Things don't stick to them. I have no idea about features such as heat distribution and heat resistance. I do intend to follow the enclosed instructions for use. The price seemed to be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find the sizes of the pans on the ad and incorrectly assumed they were a 10" & 12" set. The set actually includes one 10" skillet and one 8" skillet. These pans are a more lightweight version of the Calphalon I own and love and the handles are shorter than my original set. Also they are not dishwasher safe which was stated in the ad. Overall, a little disappointing, but hopefully they will hold up on the stove okay.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Like cooking on a balloon
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it the bottom warped. Completely rounded. Absolutely useless on my smooth top stove. Just outside the return window. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Spike61

customer_reviews.title: Great Pans!
customer_reviews.text: We received a large set of these pans for our wedding a couple years ago. The pans we used for ever, and wore down. These worked as a great replacement and have new pans without having to replace the set.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: So far so go
customer_reviews.text: I've used the pans a couple times and haven't had any problems yet. I don't get the black coating that suppose to come off. It hasn't warped but I let the pan cool down before washing it. I usually hand wash all non-stick pans. Its not their top of the line but its well constructed and has a lifetime guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: James K9

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Their older pans were a lot more rugged and had better stick-resistance. EVERYTHING stick to these pans and while I opened up a ticket with Calphalon, it's been almost a year and while they returned my email they have not followed though on their warranty, so another star is lost for poor service;
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have long used Calphalon's heavy duty cookware. However, this non-stick pot is a revelation! It heats up quickly and cleans up easily, especially scorched sauces and oatmeal. The drain-designed lid is an added benefit. At half the price of Calphalon's high-end line this is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sometimes unhappy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: DON’T BOTHER This pan is completely useless now. I read directions, followed diligently, soft tools only and the non-stick stopped working faster than pans I’ve purchased for 50% the cost. Worse yet, I have been contacting Calphalon for months and there is no response. The pan is suppose to have a lifetime warranty. Lid fits nicely, heats evenly...
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Dutch oven because we needed it! We are very pleased with how it cooks. No sticking even when making fudge and Christmas chocolate bars. I am impressed. I had thought the handles did not get hot; however, I was incorrect. You will need gloves when you handle this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Owen L. Bouma

customer_reviews.title: 7 qt Dutch oven only 6 qt cooking capacity!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it will hold 7 qts, when filled to the very top of the rim! The measure markings they have inside stop at 6 qts, with another 3/4 inches to the very top. You can clearly see the mark stops with 4 qt on their picture of the 5 qt Dutch oven. Other than that, it seemed just like the other Calphalon pots I have. It was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jan S

customer_reviews.title: I have many of this  brand
customer_reviews.text: These feel a little lighter than the older ones I have, but have held up under use. The nonstick coating is very durable and perfect for when your metal pans won't work. The handles are all easy to use, pour, lift, etc. These clean up well in the dishwasher and have been very easy hand washing. You will have this pan for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Momwith2boys

customer_reviews.title: Generally speaking it is a nice looking pan and the cover fits well
customer_reviews.text: Generally speaking it is a nice looking pan and the cover fits well. However, this pan has one very bad problem, it warps when heated. I have a glass top stove and this pan doe's not maintain a flat surface when heated. After the pan cools it loses the warp and returns flat. This pan does not allow a constant heating surface when heated. Who wants a pan that wobbles, on your stove top, when heated. This pan is in need of a redesign that thickens the base.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy them again
customer_reviews.text: my medium pan seems to be peeling from the inside in just 6 months. I ONLY use plastic spoons on it. And to wash I have a soft sponge. Before I saw the peeling everything was sticking on it. Now no matter how much oil I use everything sticks. I feel like it should be exchanged. I also ordered a large pan separately and that one works fine. The small one that came with the medium also see To work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Anana Venegas

customer_reviews.title: Good for omelettes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to replace one I’d had for several years since the coating became compromised. I like this pan even though it came with a scratch on the outer side. I didn’t necessarily need two sizes but that seemed to be the only way I could order it. I kept the lid from the previous pan since this did not come with one.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a great pot!
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of this pot, and the straining lid is wonderful. The only thing I don't like is that the pot handles and lid handles get VERY hot, much too hot to hold without a pot holder. They are just metal with nothing covering them. Having a gas stove, I don't particularly like having to hold a pot holder over the handle just to stir what's cooking; it's just too close to the flame. If the handles were covered, this would be a 5-star product in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Cool Granma in KS

customer_reviews.title: Not sufficiently heat resistant
customer_reviews.text: Does not stand up to heat. After 4 months of use the contact surface has bowed up resulting in a spinner on my conventional electric stove.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to the kitchen stock
customer_reviews.text: Good addition to the kitchen stock. Very easy to drain off excess liquid. Cooks evenly and can go directly to the table, if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mags Dad

customer_reviews.title: Just an average non stick pan
customer_reviews.text: Things I like about this product is that they are of the right size and weight, thick enough and well balanced. These pan's are okay to have. I am not a great fan of this after a couple of months use. I did't like the handle of this product also. I hate that it takes a lot of time to get it heated up. Not stick coating is not so effective because even eggs tend to stick if not very careful. I suggest to look for other products rather than going with this product by spending this amount. Date of product usage: Started Nov 3, 2017
customer_reviews.author: Kannan

customer_reviews.title: Looks and function
customer_reviews.text: My favorite pot for cooking pasta and anything that’s gonna be in massive amount. It’s large, by not too deep. At 5’2” I need to see what’s happening inside and this allows me to do that vs a deep high pasta pot.
customer_reviews.author: Kim L

customer_reviews.title: Need pot holder.
customer_reviews.text: The handles on both pans get hot on top of the stove . I wound up returning these and getting ones with silicone covering on the handles.
customer_reviews.author: imo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent non-stick skillet!
customer_reviews.text: This skillet is absolutely fantastic! We needed something that would allow extra room for doubling batches of food while cooking and this delivered quite well! From making my pie fillings to browning meat we are very happy with the out come. It is a smidge larger than our burner on our stove but that’s pretty minor. It does not stick and the lid is a great addition! Wish it had rubber grips on handles but that’s a personal want.
customer_reviews.author: Dawson2009

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, very large!
customer_reviews.text: Very large, even for my large burner which means it’s hard to distribute heat evenly. But we love this for our stir fry’s!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Greer

customer_reviews.title: Non stick? No. Hot handle? Yes.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like these. Spent $50 for something I should have spent $10 as the cheap nonstick pans I got from ikea work better and last longer. I gave it three uses, followed all directions and you can see the result. Scrambled eggs stick to it like glue. Also, while cooking a burger for six minutes, the handle got so hot I needed to use oven mitts. No reason to spend more, get the cheap ones.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Karamitas

customer_reviews.title: Good quality cookware
customer_reviews.text: Love the durability and the quality of materials used for this cookware. It disperses heat evenly and heats up quick. It non stick and very easy to clean and cook with. Would recommend product to anyone who enjoys cooking larger portions of food for their family.
customer_reviews.author: JWoohoo101

customer_reviews.title: Cook evenly. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pans. Heat well and cook well. The only issue is that the handles can get very hot. There is no insulator between the pan and the metal handle nor anything heat resistant on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the quality of this pan
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the quality of this pan. It scratches easily but you just have to be conscious when you wash it. I don't use dishwasher so cannot speak for that
customer_reviews.author: mattyjenks21

customer_reviews.title: I like these pans a lot
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with these products, I knew the small one was excellent cause my previous roommate had it so I decided to buy the pair. They are both extremely easy to clean and very non-sticky. I also remember reading a review about them leaving a black trace and I didn't experience that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo

customer_reviews.title: good quality pans
customer_reviews.text: These are both good quality, especially for the price. They are heavy and seem durable. The nonstick surface works well. I think they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Ejda

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Very very good pan. It is non stick and can handle heat well. It is extremely easy to clean as well. Great quality
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo Tamez

customer_reviews.title: So Much Better than the really cheap ones
customer_reviews.text: We had picked up a really cheap one of these in a discount store and my wife hated it. So we tossed it and got this...it's a good solid pan and cover. My wife loves it. It was not warped or anything as I saw in a handful of reviews. I would fully recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to care for
customer_reviews.text: My old T-fal pan had scratches so I decided to get some new ones. I had a large Calphalon pan that I like so decided to get this one as the replacement. The small one is the perfect size for my scrambled eggs I make every morning and food slides right out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: do not grab handle while using
customer_reviews.text: If you are even somewhat experienced in the kitchen, don't buy. You cannot grip the handle to do a proper flip without burning your lead finger(s). The only reason I gave the heat distribution a 5 star is because it distributes it perfectly to the handle to keep that evenly hot also. Frying pan handles should NOT get hot during normal use. Waste of money and cannot wait to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: ryan norton

customer_reviews.title: Do not put it in the dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one along with another Calphalon nonstick pot. They look very much alike except for the different sizes. However the other one is dishwasher safe and this one is not. But I thought it was. So after a month of use a large part of the paint on the outside has come off. It’s ugly.
customer_reviews.author: AllisonZ

customer_reviews.title: Great pasta pot!
customer_reviews.text: This pasta pot made it slightly easier to cook pasta or any type of noodles that require drainage. I cook other ingredients in the air fryer and add everything into this pot with the sauce, cheese and butter. It's easy to clean due to the nonstick quality.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality, lid takes an extra second to clean
customer_reviews.text: Would be straight 5 stars but the lids on this whole line of Calphalon cookware are just slightly a pain in the butt to clean. There is a small gap between where the glass meets the metal that you have to force the corner of a sponge into. I bought one of those bristle brushes for $2 from the grocery store to fix the issue (the kind that hold the soap in the handle).
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to my set and it fell apart quickly! I don’t use it often and typically use it to boil noodles. I don’t use metal or plastic wood only and it’s already peeling!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tina W.

customer_reviews.title: So far love these. Food releases well
customer_reviews.text: So far love these. Food releases well. Good quality. Easy to clean. I have not experienced any black residue after first wash. I always wash by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ann Dillman

customer_reviews.title: Not dishwasher safe -- unlike all my other calphalon pans
customer_reviews.text: The amazon description doesn't mention this at all but when you receive the pot, the box says "hand wash only". For some reason this pot loses its outer finish when put through the dishwasher. I have four other calphalon pots/pans that I've ran thru the dishwasher dozens of times and the outer finish is fine. Would not pay $50 for this if I can't even put it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Cookware scratches
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning I loved this cookware. However, in less than a year and with using the proper plastic and/or wooden cooking utensils, the bottom of this pot now shows scratches and is beginning to show rust in those scratches. I am not at all pleased with this!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon1928

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase - a great additional to my Calphalon pots and pans. Large enough to boil potatoes for my large family for holiday dinners and draining the is easy with the lip - no need to dirty up a colander. I also use it to make pasta - it is versatile, and you cannot beat the price - even cheaper than the outlet near my house.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Vest

customer_reviews.title: Warped after a single use despite babying the pan - very thin metal.
customer_reviews.text: This pan warped after a single use despite following the instructions closely. It was a low-heat food (pancakes), and the pan was never left on the glass top range without food in it, and it was completely cooled before washing. In fact I babied this pan because of the nonstick surface. We basically threw away 65 dollars on this as it is already at the point where the whole pan rests on a single point.
customer_reviews.author: MGD

customer_reviews.title: Scrambled eggs anyone?
customer_reviews.text: I thought the box was empty when it arrived. These aluminum pans are much lighter than my old Calphalon pans and probably not quite as oven worthy, but they heat quickly on my gas cooktop and clean very easily. Keep an oven mitt handy though because the handles get hot.
customer_reviews.author: G. Sosna

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for another 5 qt pan for regular use. Love Calphalon. This fits the bill perfectly! Love that you can strain with the lid on-like my smaller sauce pans. Great value! Would order another if I needed it (or had the room!)
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Warped in 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine till it warped in about 6 months. Now it won't sit flat on the cook top so it is useless. At least it was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: A4153

customer_reviews.title: Surface issues
customer_reviews.text: The pan cooks well and evenly and is durable and strong. It easily cleans. All great. But I have only hand-washed a few times with soft scrubbers, used flexible (not metal) turners for hamburgers and eggs, and already I see lines (not yet scratches) in the metal surface. So I decided to buy the more expensive Misen. If you are thinking like me, seeing Misen commercials and buying the less expensive brand, think again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for Every Day Use
customer_reviews.text: I have other pans by this company and love their durability and even heat surface. Every day use and have had no issues other that handles getting rather warm to touch. Use mits when handling. Still love these pans though!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Noll

customer_reviews.title: One of My favorite Pans
customer_reviews.text: Nice, big, deep for cooking all kinds of things. Cleans up nicely! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K

customer_reviews.title: Larger pan turned oval after a few months
customer_reviews.text: These are normally great pans and have used them for years. For some reason the larger of the pans came out of round over the first few months, now the glass cover doesn’t fit tightly. Calphalon quality seems to be slipping.
customer_reviews.author: robert w porter

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quality but not as nice as the larger set of stackable pots the handles are thinner on this pot and the outer part of the pot is not as nice but it still made of good quality it dosent match all the other pot made by this brand
customer_reviews.author: J&J Gifts

customer_reviews.title: Great set of frying pans
customer_reviews.text: These Calphalon pans are great! I have a large sauce pan I've used for over 5 years and the nonstick surface is still good. I really like the stay cool handles. The small pan is prefect for a one serving omlette. The pans heat up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry L. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Good 12 inch non-stick pan with cover
customer_reviews.text: Had to return my first one but it was replaced immediately. Excellent pan, however the picture is incorrect as there isn’t a helper handle but it doesn’t matter as the pan is easy to use with just the regular handle.
customer_reviews.author: Marc N

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, evenly distributed weight, and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I really like this saute pan. I have gone through a lot of saute pans over the last few years. I use them almost daily and so does my 12 year old daughter. It is a good size to cook for a family of 6. It is easy to clean and has been non-stick.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa witmer

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made and functional
customer_reviews.text: First use included browning onions, then steam/sautee-ing of additions (purple cabbage, greens, and red bell peppers). Did a fine job and cleaned up nicely. Pot is substantial, but not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this pan
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this pan. The size is perfect for my family and not having to use a strainer is great. It is also great for easily letting steam out and keeping the lid on. One of my favorite amazon purchases all year!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Lux

customer_reviews.title: Great Pans
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I needed oven safe pans to use with my dinnerly kit service. I am in love with these pans. They are super nice. I will be asking for a full set for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Zuspan

product_meta.title: Calphalon Classic Nonstick Saute Pan With Cover, 5 Quart, Grey
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Sautee Pan| Color:Gray| Size:5 quart

The Calphalon Classic Nonstick 5-Quart Saute Pan with Cover is made with dual-layer nonstick for extra-easy food release and cleanup, and is constructed from durable hard-anodized aluminum for fast and even heating. With its wide, flat cooking surface, the multi-purpose non stick saute pan gives you plenty of room to brown or sear chicken, fish, steaks or vegetables. Low sides make it easy to flip, stir and turn foods, while still keeping splattering to a minimum. This saute pan is finished with a long, stay-cool stainless steel handle. Includes oven-safe tempered glass lid to help foods retain moisture when cooking.

Use & Care:

Hand wash only. Never place cookware in an automatic dishwasher, or use abrasive cleaning pads or cleansers that can damage the pan and void the warranty. Interior: Clean the interior nonstick surface of the pan with a liquid dishwashing detergent such as Dawn and a non-abrasive sponge or soft bristle brush. Exterior: Clean the hard-anodized exterior surface of the pan with a liquid dishwashing detergent such as Dawn and a non-abrasive sponge or soft bristle brush. For stubborn spots on the exterior only, use Bar Keeper’s Friend cleanser and a non-abrasive sponge.
feature_bullets: Dual-layer nonstick for easy food release, and quick cleanup
Cast stay-cool stainless steel long handles

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,410 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
